title: m4 configure hangs indefinitely with intel@19.0.4 and craype-hugepages2M
body:
@chuckatkins @demarle 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install -v m4%intel@19.0.4
...
checking how to link with libsigsegv... -lsigsegv
checking whether locale.h conforms to POSIX:2001... yes
checking whether struct lconv is properly defined... yes
checking whether lseek detects pipes... libhugetlbfs [tt-fey1:17513]: WARNING: Hugepage size 2097152 unavailablelibhugetlbfs [tt-fey1:17517]: WARNING: Hugepage size 2097152 unavailableyes
checking whether NAN macro works... yes
checking whether HUGE_VAL works... yes
checking whether mbrtowc handles incomplete characters... yes
checking whether mbrtowc works as well as mbtowc... yes
checking whether mbrtowc handles a NULL pwc argument... yes
checking whether mbrtowc handles a NULL string argument... yes

```

Hangs here indefinitely. Note the Hugepage warning.

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux tt-fey1 4.12.14-150.38-default #1 SMP Mon Oct 7 10:54:05 UTC 2019 (3106fa5) x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 15
``` 

### Additional information

If I unload craype-hugepages, I am able to pass the configure stage for m4 in Spack.

With the same environment (module craype-hugepages2M loaded), I am able to successfully configure m4 manually with the following command retrieved from spack install -v output:
```
./configure --prefix=$SPACK_INSTALL/cray-cnl7-haswell/intel-19.0.4/m4-1.4.18-c5mla6oqweqcple76rgkgryc6zwqw26k --enable-c++ CFLAGS=-no-gcc --with-libsigsegv-prefix=$SPACK_INSTALL/cray-cnl7-haswell/intel-19.0.4/libsigsegv-2.12-jwh3oecolgcv6qdxguvnvtiugadd7tdi
```
There is no hugepage warning when configuring manually.
